titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Hatchett, Nathaniel Milbourn, & Matthew Terrell, Indictment
CWG5317

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Washington County Circuit Court
Wm Hatchett, Nathaniel Milbourn & Mat. Terrell

The Grand Jury of Washington county in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse William Hatchett, Nathaniel Milbourn and Mat Terrell of the crime of Robery committed as follows: The Said William Hatchett Nathaniel Milbourn and Mat Terrell on the 7th day of December 1864 in the county aforesaid did feloniously steal take and carry away one Pistol of the value of More than four Dollars the property of James Reed from the person and in the presence of said Reed, against his will, by force and by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Witness before the Jury James Reed. H. D. Reed
Preston Prather, George Lambert, Andrew Pinkston

L. H. Noble atty for Comwlth
A. Copy att
J. P. Barbour
clk

Indictment
Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Robery
Wm. Hatchett &cA true bill
J. R. Hughes
foreman of the Grand Jurya copy
J. P. Barbour
Clk
